metadata.title: CVE-2017-8359 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Google gRPC before 2017-03-29 has an out-of-bounds write caused by aheap-based use-after-free related to the grpc_call_destroy function incore/lib/surface/call.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgrpc++1 - 1.3.2-1.1
libgrpc10 - 1.3.2-1.1
protobuf-compiler-grpc - 1.3.2-1.1
python3-grpcio - 1.3.2-1.1
ruby-grpc - 1.3.2-1.1
ruby-grpc-tools - 1.3.2-1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: grpc package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2-1.1').
